column1: Yeah about 10 years ago I had a horrifying experience. It was 100% their fault but they hit the water barrels and survived. They had no injuries but they almost ran me off the road.	I am sure that must have been very frightening.
No I wasn't hit. It turned out they were drunk. I felt guilty but realized it was his fault.	That was terrible! I hope you didn't have to go to jail for that!

I don't know I was new to driving and hadn't experienced anything like that. I felt like my horn made him swerve into the water barrels.	Well, can you tell me about your experience? I think we swapped places	ye i went to school with a girl from my home

Oh my goodness, that's very scary! I hope you are okay now and the drunk driver was punished for his actions?	I am fine, I just got home from work and I saw the drunk driver driving away. I was walking home with my dog. I was looking up and I saw a car that was driving very slowly and I thought it was a taxi. I got to the taxi stop and I saw another car coming towards me and I was running away when a taxi stopped and I got into it and the taxi driver called the drunk guy over and he gave him his license number. I hope that the drunk
I there, dont know what to do, jst broke up with my girlfirned, we were 8 years together	That sucks. What happened?  Did you guys fight about something?
Yes we decided together with our minds, and know i come home and feel so distant from the world	That sucks, what happened? Did they break up with you?
I couldn't wait to go to the concert.	That sounds like fun! What kind concert was it?
The U2 concert. Tickets were really expensive and I never thought we would be able to go, but somehow we did!!!	oh wow! thats a bargin price to pay for tickets!

I'm so sad because i've read an article about a newborn girl who died because her parents didn't believe in medication and doctors	That's a terrible reason for a baby girl to die. I'm so sad that she died like that.

she was born premature at home, she had hard time breathing on her own but instead of taking her to the doctor parents were just praying	That is terrible.  I wish that was not the way it was.  I had a premature son who is still very healthy and the only issue is he has asthma.  He had to be born early and he's never had medication given to him in his whole life.

yes! And i do believe in God and prayers but goodness gracious please take your children to the hospital and let God heal them THROUGH doctors	so my friend's baby fell down and scraped his knee yesterday and i was trying so hard to cheer him up	That sounds so scary! Did he need stitches?
i was singing nursery songs :)	That's really nice of you. Did the nurse do anything to treat him?
If you happy and you know it :)	my husband lost a job but i'm hoping he can find a full time job soon	I am so sorry to hear that.  How can you help him?
thank you so much!	I know the struggle is real. Hopefully he finds a full-time job soon too
he is an armed guard	i just moved to this neighborhood and some dumb criminals shot one of my neighbors and ran into the woods!	That's so crazy! How badly did he/she hurt them?
I do! I want to be able to protect my son	That must have been scary! Did they catch them yet or is it still an open investigation?
i'm so excited because i'm finally going to visit my parents next month! I didn't see them for 3 years	That's awesome! Where do they live now?
I moved to the US and they stayed in my homecountry	That's really cool! What did they do while you're away?

I was very angry when a co worker lied about a car accident to get out of working July 4th. I covered his shift till midnight and he was lying about the accident	I would not do anything like that to a co-worker.

Yeah he got caught in someones pics on Facebook. Never lie and then go out with people who like to take pictures.	That is very interesting how technology has made everything easier, but also more complicated. I don't know if I would have covered the co workers shift. I wouldn't know the right to do. But I know how that can happen.

Good idea. i don't like social media that much. It can get you in to trouble fast, even when expressing your opinions.	So yeah i drove 2 hours to get to wallmart. with 299 in my wallet as advertised, and the real price of the tv was 399 usd. what a bummer	That's terrible. You could have gotten it cheaper elsewhere.

Yeah i had my hopes reall high and then i left empty handed, such a terrible feeling!	Yeah, it is always like that when you really believe you are getting something for a certain price, then you are getting a different thing

Yes, i guess walmart and the rest of false advertisement in the US, the look in my daugther eyes when i came home empty handed	My friend's boyfriend recently made a pass at me. I'm married, and I also am really good friend's with his girlfriend so I felt really bad. I made sure he knew I was loyal and honest to both!	Yeah, that's the way we should all be.

I struggled with it, but my friend was in a really bad spot, with no income and raising her grandchild, he was the financial supporter. So, I didn't tell her, as I knew it would really hurt her in several ways, plus she really loves him!	Yeah, sometimes it's better to let people down gently and not to hurt their feelings. But sometimes it is necessary to tell them the hard way.  It's like when you have to let them go, and then come back later with a better offer
my baby is sleeping. it's so peaceful and quiet in this house	Oh my goodness! That sounds lovely! How old are you?
i totally agree with you!	Yeah, it can be very peaceful and quiet.
hi, i feel so lonely sometimes because all my friends live in a different country	That's really tough. Maybe try to join a club or organization?

i was thinking about it! I wanted to join a group for local moms	That sucks. I know what that feels like. I live in the same area and I have to join a group to be friends. I wish you had someone like that.

I have a friend that has a child that is unruly and does bad things. One day at our home, he grabbed a game and sat on it, instantly breaking it! It was expensive and this really irked me, especially because she doesn't discipline him when he does bad things.	I would have just called the police on him, and also the store he bought the game from.  I think it would be a good idea to get a good insurance policy so that you can replace your game if something like happens in the future.  And maybe you could also consider talking to a lawyer about the possibility.

Me either! I have two of my own children, and I would have never let them get away with that kind of behavior when they were his age. I just don't understand those kind of parents@!	I hate when that happens to kids. I wish I had some advice to share with you about it.  What happened?
I'm so scared of bugs! i found one in my hair yesterday and almost died	I'm sure it won't bite or sting you! I bet it's a bit of gross to look back on now.

Ugh I hate bugs with a passion, they are so creepy	I recently spoke with my ex-girlfriend on the phone. The conversation went pretty well, and it reminded me of my past experiences with her.	that's so sweet of her.
Yes, they ended somewhat well, but there were tense moments. I am glad she's doing well, but I miss her.	I hope they are both doing alright.
Thank you! That means a lot.	One of the times I remember feeling the most blissed out in life was right after the birth of my first child.	I have one coming up! I am excited too!

Obviously there are the demands of a new child -- but that feeling of finally meeting someone you waited so long for, and the love surrounding the whole situation. Truly something to remember.	I agree. I feel it's something that people forget.

Have you ever been in a situation when payment of some kind has come through *just* in the nick of time?! Talk about gratitude!	That has happened.  I was at a restaurant the other day and I ordered my meal but my food was missing when I got to the counter to have them fix it for me.  I asked and they said that was just an error in their system and that I would get a new one sent to my address asap.  I got a new meal and I got my money as well.  I was so happy that they finally figured out the problem.  It couldnt have happened

Absolutely. You go from scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic in one quick moment! It's not a situation I wish to be in again.	Yeah, that happens a lot. I once had a credit card declined because of a technical glitch that left it on my credit card statement for 4 days after the fact, and I ended up having to pay the whole $500 billate the credit card company for the declined card.
Im so grateful for my family due to an incident with my friend	I know what that's like. What happened?

My friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and their family was very close to mine. So seeing her go through the grief made me realize how thankful I should be	it's always nice to see someone through hard times. I hope she gets better.

Yes definitely. Never take anything for granted as you never know when it will be taken away from you	I'm a big believer in listening to your gut. Sometimes I might wonder where my intuition is leading me, but it always seems to be spot on.	That makes sense. I've always been one who trusts her intuition.

It is a "knowing" -- and a flowing! When something is right, it just feels easier to go with it -- like you're being led, even if you might not fully know to where.	It is very helpful, especially when dealing with people and animals.

I couldnt celebrate my 18th birthday as I had exams during the time and I felt terrible for it. But my friends threw a surprise party for me and it was the best!	that's so kind of them to throw a surprise.

I was studying in my bedroom for a couple of hours straight with headphones on and then my mom called me to the living room for dinner and when I went out the whole place was decorated and everyone was there	That is really sweet of your mom.

I feel lonely sometimes cause I live in a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and sometimes they are all hanging out with their significant others and I feel lonely	That's nice of you to be lonely though, it means you care a lot about your girls' well be!

Sometimes they joke about it and obviously I make it look like its totally fine cause I dont want to give them the impression that I am lonely but it does hurt sometimes	I understand how you might feel lonely, I've had friends like you before, where everyone else is in relationships but you're not and you're just feeling the loneliness

As silly as it sounds, I was so surprised at how different my two kids were as babies. You're reminded that they're wired with their own personalities from the git-go.	I love kids that way too, but my 6 month old is still a baby and my 18 year old is still a baby.

One was pacifier, one was fingers. One wanted to co-sleep, one liked her space. One liked facing *out* in the Baby Bjorn carrier, one liked cocooning in a sling!	That's interesting how they turned out.
The other day I had a deep craving for Chik-Fil-A.	I love Chick-Fill-Up! What was it?

Mine too. So I drive there and pull in the parking lot and it's completely empty. I then realized it was Sunday.	I know right, that's what happens sometimes, you think the craving will be gone but it comes back when you least need it.
I visited an orphan once and it was such a surreal moment. It made me realise how thankful I should be for a family	That's a great story! What orphanage did you visit? I love kids!
Yes it definitely was. I went with intentions to teach the kid a few things but I ended up learning lots more from him	that's very cool. what type was it?

My oldest and my husband have always had a rough relationship. I've got to believe that as she gets older, it will get better!	i know right! it is so hard when parents don't get along. i had a parent and child relationship conflict and they both ended. it was so hard.

That's always good to hear. But in the moment -- argh, my *heart*. How did your mom maneuver the differences between y'all? Did that wear on her?	You're right though. I've been married to my best friend since 2003. I don't know if I'm ready to let go. I hope it works out. I just don't know if I'm ready to let her in. I'm a 50-year-old man who's been married for 45. I don't think I've ever even kissed another woman before.  I just knew I'd end up breaking up. I just knew I'd end up breaking her

But in the meantime -- the unspoken strain is NOT fun. But I'm glad to hear about a happy ending -- thank you for that!	I can still look back with shame at the way I treated a girl in sixth grade. I wasn't as bad as others, but that doesn't make me feel any better.	That's terrible, what happened?

Well, like a lot of 6th graders I was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. And unfortunately, she was. As an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!	It's never easy to look at the mistakes you've made in the future, but I hope you can forgive yourself for those mistakes. It's easy for others to do the forgiveness, though I hope you can. I'm sorry you had to experience that as a kid though

Unfortunately, she died. I only found out when Facebook first came out, and her brother and I "friended" one another.	That's terrible. I'm so sorry for you. I hope she's at peace. I know that she would have wanted you to be there. I'm so glad you were there for her.
I'm currently working for someone that is *such* a great example of a leader! It makes going into work inspiring every day / every way.	That's a good thing to hear.

That's a very kind statement, and certainly what I would strive for. And it's the rarity that *inspires* me. That should be the norm, not the exception! THAT'S what I'd like to inspire in people. How about you?	That sounds like a great leader.
That is soul-sapping. What do you do to inspire yourself, and not let that kind of behavior drag you down?	That's the right kind! I'm glad to be a part of it.
My friend's baby has grown so much since the last time I had seen her!	That sounds so exciting. What happened?
It had been about 8 weeks - I don't get out her way often, even though we live 30 minutes away.	That must have made it tough.

Yes!  I got to be 'auntie' for a bit and help change her and get her fed and down for a nap while my friend had a chance to toss laundry in the wash.  It was a good day for everyone!	Running my first (and maybe only!) marathon felt like *such* a huge accomplishment!	That's awesome! Congratulations! What was that marathon for, if you know!
Ah, it was the best! Plus it helped that I purposely chose an amazing destination in which to run it -- it was the Venice Marathon!	Yeah! That was one awesome experience! What city was your favorite?
We were living overseas at the times -- the most impressive part was crossing the Grand Canal over a pontoon of boats to finish the marathon ;-)	That's great!

I recently found out that a person I very much intimately admired did not feel the same way for me. I was pretty surprised.	That's really sad. Did they say something like that to you or do you think they did? What happened?
She just started treating me differently all of a sudden. And now she is going to be moving away soon.	That's terrible. What happened? Did they say anything like that before they started dating?

I'm always appalled when I see bullying in action -- whether it's on a playground or political stage -- not much makes me angrier.	I agree.  There has never been as much to fight against as there has been in recent history.  I hope we see more people standing up against bulling behavior.

How do you channel the anger? Obviously, it too easily turns into the same kind of negative emotion I'm upset about -- so that can feel hypocritical!	It is a good question. I have found that I try to focus my energy on finding solutions.  I try to see things as a problem rather than a solution to the issue at hand.

Are you ever tempted to put anyone's face on the punching bag?! Ha! (Kidding/not kidding!)	One morning my mother came to my house to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat on the road and he had been hit. I had to tell my daughter about the loss of her beloved pet.	That's terrible. I'm sorry she's missing her cat.
She was around 11, so she took it very hard. I went ahead and let her stay home from school, as I knew she wouldn't do well that day.	That is very kind of her, I'm sure she will do alright.
I was soooo excited to take our kids to Disneyland for the first time!	oh yeah thats so much better than the movies lol

Same! I was excited because I grew up going there. My grandparents lived in Tucson, and we would spend the summers with them -- the most exciting part being our drive to Disneyland each year!	I have never been there.

California! Old school ;-) They've kept so much of the original, while adding lots of new attractions.	I recently spoke to my father for the first time in years. It reminded me of my childhood and the distant past.	I bet you enjoyed it.
We spoke about our recent lives. Apparently he is in the market for a new car.	That's great! What kind is he looking at?

Do you like to organize your house.  My mother-in-law recently surprised me recently with some organizing stuff b/c she knows how much I love it!	That's a really kind thing to do. I've never had my mom's house cleaned and organized. I like that kind of thing. I like my space to myself, but it's nice for my family too

Labels and Bins can be your best friend!  Especially with a new baby.	It sounds like you are a neat person. I like how you mention your mom-in law because it is always good to be thankful to those people who care about you.
I find it odd -- and annoying -- when people don't respond to or even acknowledge emails.	That is weird. I have had people do that. I guess it can be rude.

It would be great if there was a way we could all tell the best way to reach someone -- I know some people prefer texts to emails -- but if you're in a work situation, how do you ensure communication?	I agree.  I've got to respond to my coworkers every day to keep up.  And sometimes I have to respond to emails.  It can be a lot sometimes when people don't respond to my emails.
I recently had a big argument with my sister. We both got very upset and angry at each other.	That is terrible, did they resolve the issue?
I'm not so sure. We just had a discussion that heated and became an argument with tempers flying.	That's unfortunate that happened to both you and your sister, I hope that issue will be resolved.
I felt most lonely when we first moved overseas, my husband then had to travel out of *that* country for business -- AND I had a new baby!	That's terrible. What country were they in?
From Santa Fe to Hong Kong -- ultimately a fantastic adventure. And I ended up with a wonderful group of friends. Expats bond quickly!	that's nice

One of the saddest things to me is when people underestimate what they can do and/or are capable of.	It is so frustrating when people don't realize their own abilities. It can make you feel inadequate and unconfident.

That's perfectly natural. You sound like the kind of person, though, that quickly regained their bearings. Disappointments like that usually come with some *good* lessons.	That's great that they came out okay. I'm glad you were there to remind them of that.

Once my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was busy that day when she needed his help but I told her anyway.  I really felt bad b/c he got pretty upset with me.	That's a pretty typical husband situation.  You guys need to learn to be honest with each other.

Yeah thats a good question.  I totally deserved him being mad.  I just felt bad for him b/c he was so busy that day and I didn't want him to have one more thing on his plate I guess	I think it is always better to tell him what to do. He can't just let things go and expect them to happen. It would be better if he was happy and you didn't do that to him.

There was a back neighbor that called my 10 year old son a ugly name one time, simply because he entered her yard slightly when he rode around the corner.!	Oh my, that's awful. Did he apologize him later?
Yes, she lived several house back and she didn't know me, until after she did that! She knew me then, but after I talked to her, she apologized to both of us.	That sounds terrible.
Too often, it's a health scare that makes us value health. It inspires me to try and do something to keep healthy every day.	I have been doing that for years.

Happily, I don't have one! It's more seeing family and friends and the situations they're in. Not everything can be helped -- but there are some things we can all do to take care of ourselves, you know?	I'm a little jealous, actually. I wish I could do more. I wish to be healthier, and I wish I had someone who cares to be healthy. I wish for myself to be able to help. I wish for the people I love. But sometimes life's hard, too. Sometimes we just get older, or we get older and healthier, but still. We have to try. And sometimes we just get lucky and healthy! I'm lucky, I think.

Every time I look through older photos of my children, I'm taken right back to the time they were that size, and what we were doing! It's a bittersweet feeling, for sure.	That is a bitterst feeling. I wish you guys all my happiness and that you can look back on those days with happiness. I miss those days a lot myself.

Are your kids adults now?	That is so true, I look at my pictures and feel old, but I know that my life was full and I'm so happy for my kids. I'm proud of them.  It's nice that you have pictures from when they were younger, though it reminds of how you used to do things when you were younger too.  I look at my kids all the time, especially the kids!

I have an 18 year old as well -- I don't know about you, but it's hard to consider her an adult sometimes!	I have a hard time having confidence in myself but when I got married and I had my hair and makeup done I felt like I was beautiful!  I had so much confidence in myself that day and it was great!	Oh, that is awesome! I have a sister and she looks amazing every day of her wedding, and every time. She's a supermodel and supermodeler!

I really try but it's hard to replicate that day for sure.	Oh yeah, it was great. I'm sure you will get there eventually. You just have to keep working towards it. I'm sure you're a very capable and beautiful woman!

My husband and I both work for ourselves -- a blessing and a curse at times, since it can be tough to determine a "regular" income.	That's cool. I have never worked alone before. How did you two meet up?

We found a pretty good balance in that I have a part-time job that I *love* -- and that comes with benefits like insurance. That's a big worry addressed, right there.	It's nice. I wish you both the best. I hope your husband finds success.

I am sorry, because I absolutely know that concern. I truly hope you find a resolution to that.	I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected	That's okay, it's okay to still enjoy the relationship even if it's not working as planned.
Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfriend.	Oh. Well that was awkward.

I know right! No warning or anything. He turned out to be a nice guy, but I thought it was a little misleading on her part.	My family and I are going on vacation in a few weeks. We rented a largo beachfront condo and I can't wait!	That is awesome. What are you and the family looking for in the condo
We are going to be staying at Miramar Beach in Florida, about an  hour Panama City Beach. The view is amazing from our balcony and we are so ready!	I bet it's nice.
I was supposed to go for brunch with my friend Maria the other day. At least that was the plan.	I love that word.  What kind was it?  Was it French?

Well, we had initially agreed to meet at 11. Wouldn't you know it, she didn't end up returning my text until 3PM!	That is a bummer, did she respond quickly enough? I would have left without going back to her house.  What was the plan to go for brunch?

Me and my mom were at this grocery store recently and this guy started following us outside the store and then again inside the store it was so scary!	Oh, I bet that was so scary!  Did you call the grocery store police to report him to?

Well I knew he was following us and so I asked the manager to walk us out to the car and when he did we saw the guy come out again from between the two buildings b/c he was waiting on us.  so scary!	I would have asked the police to come
Did I tell you what happened with Li the other night? Boy do I feel dumb.	Yeah I did, what happened?

She's 45 minutes late to our anniversary dinner. I don't know what happened to me but I called and left an angry message. Turns out, she had gotten T-boned at an intersection and was talking to the Police Officer when I called!	That is horrible.  I am sorry.  I hope she is okay.
Ugh! I looked like such a fool at my girlfriend's work party!	I bet she saw that!  What happened?

Well, I ended up having way too much to drink. One of her co-workers had a bottle of Fireball (gross I KNOW) and was making everybody do shots. I didn't want to look foolish, so I had... well too many.	Oh my goodness, what happened there. I hope you made it home in the same clothes as your work attire.
Did I tell you what happened with the concert I was supposed to go to Saturday?	I did not hear.
Well first of all, it wasn't just any concert - it was Jay-Z and Beyonce! AND IT GOT RAINED OUT!	It did, I am sorry to hear
You are never going to guess who was sleeping on the couch when I got home from New York...	Oh, wow! Did you guess? I bet! Did he or her?
My friend Benny! The one we all thought died in a monsoon in Thailand!	that sounds pretty interesting. I bet you guys had some wild times! Did you end up hanging out again?

Recently, my husband came home from grocery shopping and had gifts for me for Mother's Day. He had a beautiful diamond ring and other lovely gifts, it was very unexpected!	I'm happy you have gifts from your husband.

I did! I also gave him unexpected gifts and he was super happy. I was very touched by him being so thoughtful!	I love surprises like that.  It shows that you care and want to make an effort to do so much.
I know I shouldn't count my chicks before they hatch, but I'm feeling pretty good after that interview today!	oh that sucks that happened to me last year
This advertising company! The owner was there - you should have seen his face. My last freelance project was a real winner. Think I got it?	Oh, really good! What kind is the work they're doing here?
Did I ever tell you about the time I "got taken hostage"?	What happened?

As a heart attack. It was me and Big C at the World's Largest Pistachio. All of the sudden we hear gunshots, and DiDi's still in the car. We ran in the building, and he comes flying in after us. He never pointed the gun at us, and we ended up running away when he was distracted. It's too crazy - I can't make this up. Just glad to be alive!	That's crazy! What happened after?

I went to visit a friend one day and her boyfriend made a pass at me. He actually suddenly kissed me, as I was waiting for my friend to return. I couldn't believe his nerve!	That's awful. Did you let him off that easy?
I quietly pushed him away, as I didn't want my friend to hear. I was so shocked and upset, since he knew I wouldn't want to make a scene and took advantage.	I would feel the way you feel.

This past Friday night our refrigerator stopped cooling! We had to go the weekend without it, and of course had to deal with some unpleasant smells and throw away a large amount of food! It wasn't a fun weekend for us!	its normal for a few things to go out of order sometimes

Yes, and of course we tried to call and have someone come out, but to no avail! You don't realize how much you rely on things like that until they aren't working!	That's the truth! You'd think it's easier to call and ask when things are broken or something, but people don't think that way.

I felt pretty bad when I was having girl talk with my friend and we were talking about our partners. Her boyfriend had made a pass at me, but I never told her about it.	That's terrible! Did you tell your friend?

I felt bad, but she wasn't working and taking care of her grandchild, and her boyfriend was the financial support. I knew it would really be hard on her if she found out, not to mention she really loves him.	I feel you, I once told a friend that her boyfriend had made a pass at me and she never told me that her boyfriend was her financial partner and that she loved him.
I was at the mall and hug my mom and said to her: Time to go Mommy! and i wasnt her, can you imagine my reaction to it?	that's cute!
Yes, totally but at the moment i felt like the stupidiest person on earth, didn't know were to hide! and my mom was watching	that's funny, I would have done that too

THe good thing about it, was the lady, she was laughing and later told me that it has happened to her childrens to, no worries!	I am looking forward to going on vacation in a few weeks! We have a condo reserved on the beach, with fantastic ocean views. I'm ready!	That sounds amazing! I bet you're really excited!
Well, we are staying at Panama City Beach, so we're right there at the Gulf of Mexico.	It should be very nice!

I am definitely a proud parent of our 15 year old -- she was determined to work this summer, and even with us saying no one would hire her until 16 -- she found a job!	That's a good point. She's so smart and capable.

That, and she's enjoying the independence of having her own money. Remember that? Making money that you truly could use for your *pleasure* (and not just necessities ?! ;-))	I remember that. You were so proud of her.  What did you do with her money?

Same! I was surprised 15 year olds *can* actually work during the summer. It's just finding an employer who knows those hours get cut WAY back once school starts.	Okay, a silly pet peeve but one nonetheless -- when people just leave their grocery carts willy-nilly in the parking lot. No consideration for others or the people who work at the store!	I totally get that.  It can be frustrating.
Me too. And I will always make sure to at *least* put it in one of those cart corrals, if not walk it back up to the store. Hey -- extra exercise ;-)	You should have a "No Store" sign on your door.

WE CAN SAVE THE WOOOOOOORLD!!!!! (lol indeed....!)	I came home, and my wife showed me a picture in 4d of our future baby, my heart speeded so fast!	That's really cool! What a lucky day! Did you guys already know?
We choose to wait! but the amount of happiness in my body is tremendous! never felt this way before.	that must be amazing! i wish you the best.

Yes, God willing the baby is going to be healthy in every way! can wait to ave the second	I love being in the "flow" -- whether it's in speaking to a group of people or working to help facilitate meetings.	That's really interesting. What kind of flow are we talking?

I work with different organizations on strengthening their culture, and I do large-scale visual notetaking (also known as graphic recording). Are you familiar with that at all? (Not unusual NOT to be!)	Yeah, I am! It is a very common practice in business meetings and presentations.

That's one of the huge benefits -- learning about many different industries and subjects!	I LOVE when leaders know that it actually *helps* them to be surrounded by strong people -- people they can learn from, that challenge them, and that in some ways could be considered "better".	Yeah! It is.  I had to leave my company recently.  I felt like I left behind my friends and colleagues.  But then I started to think about why they were so happy to leave and it wasn't so bad.  They just didn't like where the money was going and were not happy to keep working.  I am trying to do something similar now.
It's just too many leaders want "yes men" and/or people who feel non-threatening. It's a trap and a quick path to mediocrity, if not failure!	It really makes sense. I donot know why.

I'll always remember the day I learned I was pregnant with our first child -- Halloween in Chicago, and we were with friends at the Shedd Aquarium! I've loved baby belugas since ;-)	That was a fun time.
Ha! True that ;-) That's also the year that A Bug's Life came out, and we always thought of our young one as "Dot", the spunky little girl ant in the movie.	That must have been exciting.

As a kid, I was SO frightened any time there was a tornado warning. Not sure if it was the Wizard of Oz effect or what -- I just remember being frozen with fear.	I remember that! We had a tornado last summer. I was scared too. I just ran inside the car with my mom.

That's the thing -- NO! I mean, there were some that were kind of close -- but NOTHING like what so many folks have to deal with. I just remember wanting a basement sooooo badly -- not something that's common where I grew up!	That's awful.

My mom said the best thing once when I was babysitting and a tornado warning went off and I didn't want my own fear to affect the little boy I was with -- she was on the phone and just said "You have big plans for the future, right? Nothing is going to get in the way of that." For some reason, it worked a charm ;-)	That makes sense.

I feel so bad when I think back to times that I got angry and yelled at my kids for no real good reason -- just a combination of the day's events and feeling irritated, really.	that is pretty common for adults.

Yes! THAT I feel good about! Making a point to use it as an opportunity to talk. I will, and thank you so much for the encouragement.	I've been passively job hunting for a few months now, looking for a better job. I haven't had any luck yet and I'm starting to feel like I never will.	That's frustrating, but it will come around.  Keep at your current pace.

My buddy Stefan. He used it to print hundreds of bootleg concert posters. We sold them and netted $2000 a piece!	That's a lot. I'd want that too! What was it like selling them?
I finished first in a race. I feel like gold	That's awesome! What kind of racing was that for you to be talking like gold!
Yes! It was my first victory. All my hard work is paying off	that's great news, keep it up!
Some of my friends told me that they had a big surprise for me. They know I hate surprises, but I complied and let the blindfold me and drive me out to the location.	That's awesome! What was it?
They had decided to pool their money together and get me one big present together. It was a flying lesson at the local airport.	that's really generous of them! did you have fun?
I found an old photo album at my grandma's house that had pictures of me when I was a kid	That's so cool! Did you show your kids those?
Yeah, it did. I really miss the 90s. Everything seemed a lot simpler in those days	I am sure it was a good time back in your childhood days.

When I was in middle school, I had a friend come over to ride horses with me. After riding my mother pressured me to get on a horse bareback I wasn't comfortable riding. She made such a big scene that I got on to make her stop.	that's awesome, you're a brave person!

Yes, the horse took off running and I got thrown into a metal fence. My mother then proceeded to yell and me and make fun of me for trusting her. She told me that I should never trust anyone not even my own parents, it was really embarrassing to get yelled at in from my friend. Afterwards my ribs hurt for 2 months.	Yeah, that was really embarrassing. I would have just laughed it off and said something like "Mommy, you're so crazy!" but instead she just yelled at me for like an hour. It's like she thought she was the only one who could ride a horse or something.

My friend really wanted me to go rollerblading with him, but I haven't been rollerblading since I was a little kid. I didn't want to roll into a car.	I know right! It's like you're a rollerblading baby again
We went, but it was still pretty terrible because I felt completely uncomfortable and was bent over the whole time ready to catch myself.	I love rollerblading but I understand why it might be scary.
My husband is on the road a lot, I hardley ever see him.	I bet, how often

Yes, its hard but I try to remember he does it for our family! I have been trying to adapt to enjoying alone time.	That sucks. I have to go to a lot of work functions myself. But I understand the sacrifices your making. I just wish he didn't go so much. It's hard.
I have an interview for a job that I don't feel qualified for	I know how you're doing, but you should really work hard on this interview
I will try. I'm a pretty anxious person in general so it's hard	That can be nerve wrecking, especially when interviewing.
I'm moving in a few months to a new state, I'm starting to feel nervous.	That is exciting! Where are you moving to in this state?
To my husband hometown so it'll be new for me but he is excited to be back near family.	That must be scary to start over, but it can also be a chance to start fresh and do new things!
I saw a dog get hit by car today on the highway.	I am so mad right.

It was pretty tramatic, I still see the dog getting hit in my head and the sound. No, I was on my way to work, I couldn't stop :(	Yeah that's terrible. I can't believe people are driving so fast and they don't see animals in their way.
I can't even begin to tell you how nervous I was about my first tattoo.	That must have felt bad
Definitely! I get lightheaded when I see my own blood, and my pain threshold was low at the time. It turned out great though, and now I have several!	Yeah tattooing sounds terrifying!
I love my husband! He has been so sweet this week!	I bet! What's he done recently?  I love when that type thing happens!

He knew I had a rough day today so he brought home my favourite wine and Taco Bell! It's the little things :)	That's so kind of your spouse, it's so nice that you appreciate him for that! I'm so lucky that my spouse loves me back!
It's been a great week!	I love Fridays. What's the reason?
I got a promotion at work that I wasn't expecting!	That's great! Congratulations! What did they offer you in terms of pay?
Music is a powerful thing. Sometimes it feels like it can transport you to another time and place. You know what I mean?	I agree, music has the power of transporting us. It is so unique

Who can deny it? My dad passed away 2 years ago. Sometimes I put on his old records and imagine what it would have been like to hang out with him in the 70s.	I am sure he will be in good hands. I hope so too. I know it can be tough. I hope so for you too. It will take time.  I remember my grandma passing away. I hope so too. It was a tough time for me.
I was feeling kind of down so I ended up snuggling with a stuffed rabbit I have. It brought back a lot of good old memories.	That's nice, I like to have a stuffed animal around sometimes too.

Awe yeah thanks. He's pretty soft even though he some derpy eye that point in opposite directions. Brings me a lot of comfort and reminds me that someone cares.	Oh man, I love those old stuffed animals! I used mine all the time when I was a little girl
My dog got hit by a car.	That's terrible. I hope he's okay. I've been in some terrible accidents.
He did not live. I've never felt so sad before.	That sucks. I'm sorry for your loss.
Some random guy was in my backyard, I didn't realize before I looked outside that I was missing pants.	That's crazy! Was he there to do anything?

Turns out he was the cable guy fixing a wire. Still mad he didn't ask permisson first.	Oh, that's a little too much to ask for permission, right.  I mean, I understand that you were busy, but maybe he could have just asked you first.  Maybe he was just a little too aggressive about his cable installation and thought that you didn't care.  I mean, I don't think I would have wanted to ask permission to enter my yard either, but that's not really what he did, right?
My family is still hasn't recovered from the untimely passing of my father two years ago.	It's hard when people have to say their last words while they're still suffering from illness

My siblings and I are managing, and have found some peace. My mother is a different story. It was just so sudden and unexpected.	I'm so sorry to hear that. It's been two years and I hope it's been a while.
I've got a week off from work. Time to sleep in and binge watch my favorite shows.	That's great news! What shows are you binge-walking?
I like It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. I'm rewatching it for the third time	What shows is that about?
I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.	Oh wow. What kind were you in grad school in?

That is what I was thinking at the time, but I've been having a really tough time finding a job where I can advance into a higher position. I always seem to get positions with no mobility.	Yeah, it is tough.
I tripped on some steps in front of a whole bunch of people on my way to class.	That's awful. Did anyone laugh?
It was pretty humiliating. I fell flat on my face.	That's terrible! Did you trip again on your way back?
My boyfriend is sick. He can't eat much so I made some soup for him	That sounds great.  Did he like it?
I made chicken noodle soup.	That is kind of gross.  I would rather he eat something else.  How long will it last him for?

I had a meeting last week where I gave a presentation over the wrong documentation and no one said anything until after the meeting.	That's a bumpy start to the meeting. I bet the boss was not pleased.
After I figured out what I did, I sure was. Ate at my cube ever since I don't even want to make eye contact with anyone.	That's frustrating, did they apologize to anyone?
I have a really big meeting next week. I have rehearsed what I am to go over all this past week and plan to practice a little more this weekend.	that's good!
It's a meeting presenting a new product to the board. Big stuff and big money for the company.	That is awesome! Are you nervous about this meeting?
I caught my boyfriend texting his ex	oh, i see. I thought you said you caught him?
It was definitely a bit flirty. I think he misses being with her	That's a good point, but also, maybe he was trying to get back together or something. I hope so!
I know I broke up with my ex, but I can't help but feel irritated when he talks about going on dates.	that's weird. I know it's weird when exes talk about other people. I think that's why.
We actually get along really well and are much better friends than a couple. I guess I still just get a littler territorial, i think he does too.	That is good.  You guys are good friends.
I can't wait to see my final grades. I think I got all A's this semester.	It's good that you worked hard.

On Monday. I'm going to treat myself if I did well	That's a good thing. You should get them on Monday. You deserve it after all you've been through!  You're going to treat yourself and go get some cake!
I was very upset when I found my kitten today.	It is always sad when you find out something has happened that you thought was safe.
No, I had to put it down. It ate a poisonous plant. He should not have been outside.	I am sorry. I hope he is okay.
I cried a bit, but kept it together for my little girl because she had let him out.	I enjoy visiting the nursing home on occasion.	I bet you do. Nursing homes can be fun places to visit.
Not really, I take my daughter to see them, so many of them have no visitors at all.	it's a good experience. I used to be a bit of a shy kid but now I'm a big deal.
She likes to bake, so we take them what she makes :)	That's so cool.
She is pretty good for an eleven year old, better than I was.	That sounds like you guys like her baking a lot!

I had a secret and went to my mother to confide in her, as well as get off my chest. I know she would never betray my secret and can always count on her.	That's really sweet of you.  I'm glad you confided in your mom.  I have a secret too, but I'm too scared.
Yes, I sure do! There aren't many people you can feel that way with and I am so grateful!	Oh wow! That must've been very special for you. What was it?
My son applied to a prestigious college and the wait killed us. I was anxious and nervous waiting to see if he was accepted!	oh man that's so cool. what is he going for admission to?
He did! He's in his 3rd year, going to be an Aerospace Engineer, so we are very proud of him.	Wow that's great news! I hope he has a long career ahead of himself.  What major is he interested in?
My sister passed away several years ago. She took her life, and my mother and I found her right after she did it. This was very painful, traumatic and hard for us all.	That must've been really tough.

It didn't really seem to sink in for my mother for awhile, she was in denial. But, it was so hard when it did. I went into a depression for awhile, as she was my only sibling and we were very close.	I'm sorry you had to deal through such a difficult situation.  It's always good for you though to go into a depression and then come out stronger.  You'll get through it.  It's not the end.  I know that.
When my son first started college, I felt so much love and affection, but it was definitely hard to see him go! I was very proud though.	That's great! How old was he?

He went to the University of Alabama in Huntsville. It's focused on science, engineering, etc. He's going to be an Aerospace Engineer. It's great to see him go for his dreams!	That's great! I'm glad to hear. I'm happy you're so happy for him. He's going to do great things! I'm proud too! He's always been so focused on his studies. He's a smart one too! I wish I had been more supportive when he first came to college, but I'm happy I could be more supportive now when I can see the impact.
We went on vacation a few weeks ago and went to the beach, It was so relaxing and great. I really enjoyed the time with my family.	Oh that's so nice! Where did you go?

That's great! I'm sure you earned it, just like we do. It's so good to get some time away from the hustle and bustle of life!	I'm sure you did, you deserve it too. I'm happy I could remind myself of the importance. I'm going to go back this weekend and spend time on the beach again!
I am looking forward to next week! My husband has been out of town on business for several weeks and comes home next weekend!	That's exciting! What is he doing?
I am going to cook a special meal and see if he wants to go out, just us two. I know he will like that.	That's so cool! I hope you two make up next weekend!

My husband has been out of town a few weeks for work but is coming back next weekend. I have a surprise night planned for just us. I am optimistic and sure he will really enjoy it.	That's really sweet of him. What are you having planned?

Thanks! We've been married almost 23 years but I try to keep things fun and spend time together.	I hope you both have a wonderful night and enjoy each other! I've been married 24 years and have to be careful not to spoil things!  I like to surprise the husband. It keeps him young at heart!  I love my wife, we've always been so good about keeping things fun and exciting.

My son went back to college recently and it had me feeling a bit nostalgic. I could just picture him starting Kindergarten and it seemed not so long ago!	Oh yeah, time flies. Yes, very. But, time sure has flown by with him growing up. I can just see his little blonde head when he was 5 and just starting school!	It's great that he's grown. I remember going back. I was so young.

Yes, thank you! I had worked very hard through the years, and I felt that I earned it, and would do well at it.	That's good to hear that! Congratulations!

Yes, and she had two children of her own, similar in age. Her son also weighed more than mine! Yeah i feel your pain, i always forget something and then have to scramble to buy it. I'm going on a cruise in a few days so I will be sure to do everything in advance to avoid any mistakes

One day I was visiting a friend and her boyfriend came up and kissed me, while I was waiting for my friend to return from another room! It was sneaky and repulsed me!	That's weird, did you guys not feel uncomfortable with it?

I didn't....only because of her situation. She had custody of her very ill and handicapped infant grandson, she wasn't working so depended on him financially and she was very much in love with him. She already suspected he was with other women, and stayed.....	I bet she felt betrayed.
The other night I was home alone and all of a sudden I heard someone knocking at the door really loud and they wouldn't stop. I was so scared.	That's so scary! Did you call 911 or call the police?
No, I ignored them and they finally went away. I was just about to call the police before they left though. I hope that doesn't happen again.	That's a bit scary, did you ever see anyone else?

It was so much fun and such a happy night. I'm trying to embrace my age now and not ignore it any more	That is awesome! Did anyone bring cake or balloons?

A few weeks ago, my husband and I had a big argument. I said some pretty hurtful things, and wished I hadn't. I felt very bad and disappointed in myself afterwards.	That's terrible, did you both work out of it?
Yes, that's true. I tend to be a bit more verbal on my end and say things I regret later.	That's terrible, did he say anything?
One night when my kids and I came home, I saw a shadow in my hallway as I came in the back door. I was so scared and was afraid someone had broken in my home.	That would have scared you, right?

Yes, and I live out in the country so I wouldn't get a quick response time from emergency vehicles. But, luckily, it turned out to be my shadow!	I am sorry but I think you might have had something else there instead. I would have noticed it.

There was a day that I was a bit short on cash on hand and I didn't give money to a homeless man. I usually always do, as I feel it's my part to help those in need, as I am blessed. I felt very bad that I didn't that day.	That was very honest.
Well, homeless people aren't common in my area, so that's why I felt a bit bad about it.	That's very kind of you, to think that.
When my children were born, it was a rejoicing time for me. I can't think of a time I felt more happiness.	That's awesome. What were their ages when they were born?
Yes, I have two children and I feel so blessed to have them. I lucked out and got a boy and girl, both healthy, smart and wonderful.	That's great to have two children. I hope you are enjoying them.
I used to work in a place where all my colleagues had different believes to myself. I wanted to stay true to what I believed in, so had to walk away from conversations on many occasions.	its tough

Just that all people should be given an equal chance in life and that no one type of person is better than another, just because of their religion or skin color, or where they come from.	I agree completely with you there.

They believed that people of their religion where better than everyone else and were going to heaven, while the rest of us are left at the gate! That's one of their beliefs anyway. I don't agree with that, but chose to keep my mouth shut!	I recently bought a new car after not driving for several years and I was really scared to drive it, especially on the highway.	That's crazy! What kind was that car?

Just a Honda Civic. People drive crazy around here. I don't want to have another car accident like the last one.	Yeah, traffic in LA can be pretty bad. But, at the end of the day, you're gonna drive anyway.  It's your job.
I recently joined a group to help me lose weight. I have so much respect and admire everyone in that group so much.	that sounds great. What did they do to help you lose weight?

It has really helped to have their support. I am so grateful for them	That sounds like it is really helpful to have support, especially when you are trying to change your body.  Do you have any tips on how they help with losing weight?

I passed! Turns out you only had to answer three questions correctly. But they have 50 to choose from so you have to study the lot!	I'm glad you were successful.

Thank you. My poor husband had to sit every single night and test me. He's American and he didn't think he could pass!	I found some old Christmas cards the other day and had a lovely time reading them and reminiscing about the people who sent them.	That's great! Christmas memories can bring back such wonderful times. What kind did the old cards hold special for?

It was so nice. I'm terrible about throwing cards out. I feel, if someone's taken the time to write, I should preserve it. Does that sound silly?	I don't know, but I like throwing cards away, but then I think about the people.
That's very true. My Dad kept everything too. When he passed we had quite a task sorting through things. I think my brother's still at it!	That sounds like a lot!
I believe you are right! My family are going to go nuts when they see what they've got to deal with, lol.	Yeah, they were like a bunch of wild animals.
When I was entering the store it was really slippery.	I know that. It was a bit icy.
It had been raining , so I ran across the parking lot in to the store. I slid about 3 feet.	I bet that hurt! Did you hurt yourself too bad?
I was fine, just felt like every one was looking at me.	I am feeling a bit guilty about keeping a secret for my friend.	I do, what's it about?
I don't want to out her to her husband, usually the only thing that happens is they drop the friend.	I understand.  You should probably call her.
Thanks, I am just going to avoid them until it plays iteself out.	I feel kind of blue today, they announced the parts for the annual play.	Oh. I hope everything goes okay.
I did, and it is a good one, just not the one that I wanted. I didn't want the lead or anything.	Oh no, that's terrible.
It is, my friend got it, or I wouldn't think about it so much. Thanks for the kind words though.	I'm teaching my daughter how to drive, and so far, so good!	That's really cool!

She is!  At first, though, she was very nervous.  I told her we could start off slow - her dad lives 1 mile from me down a quiet road, so we started driving back and forth between the two houses.	that makes sense.  i used to be the nervous type when it comes driving.  but over the years, it gets easier and easier.  the important thing is to stay safe and follow the rules of the road.

Hopefully by the first of the year.  We've worked up to driving to the dollar store 5 miles away.  She's still a little nervous but she's getting better and more confident the more we practice.	That's nice that you're taking care of her and trying to help her. I'm glad to hear!
I do what I can where I can.  Can't wait for our hard work to pay off and she gets her license!	Yeah that's great news! You and her are going to be great driving together soon
My house is a mess and I've got people coming over later on this evening.	That can happen to us too.

I'm going to try to.  If worst comes to worse, I'll just toss everything in my back bedroom, shiny up the floors and hope for the best!  *chuckle*	I hope everything gets cleaned.  I hope everything gets put back.  I hate mess

My brother and I recently had to sell a house and he dealt with everything. I'm so lucky to have a brother I can rely on and who I know won't try and con me.	That's so kind of him. He's really good at that. He always looks out for me.

We did and he was so precise with who got what and made sure he sent me my share quickly. He's such a neat brother in so many regards. I always know he'll be there for anyone who needs help.	that sounds good
We weren't always close. When we were kids we were always fighting. It wasn't until we got older that we got closer. We're best of friends now.	it's so nice that they've been friends for that long.

Don't be! There are many, many types of relationships and I don't think ours is necessarily typical. It's just the way it is :)	I completely understand that. I've been there too. But, at the same time, sometimes it takes a while. I'm happy for you. I wish you and your friend well.

My son was in advance placement and honors during high school. He went to a prestigious college after, going for as an Aerospace Engineer. He never ceases to astonish me with his intelligence and admire me with how hard he works to pursue his dreams.	That's great! I'm glad to hear that. I've always been proud to be the parent of a smart kid.  I'm glad he's going where he wants. It's not every kid who is going on a good path. You must be so happy to hear this.  I'm sure it's going well for you.

I am quite proud, thank you! I also have a teenage daughter that is very smart and an amazing artist, (which I don't know where she gets that talent). They really impress me with amazing they are!	I'm sure they do. They're smart and talented young kids. It's good to appreciate them when they're young.
Going out today to learn a new route for my job and I'm hoping that I don't get lost.	That sounds like fun! Where are you going? Are there new foods you are trying out on the job?

I got the assignment yesterday, and I told myself that I'd go drive around it today and tomorrow.  My boss is supposed to ride along with me the first week, and then after that I'll be on my own.	That's great! Are you nervous?

I was over here in the US when my Grandma passed in Scotland. I was so upset - nobody could get hold of me to tell me and her funeral was over before I knew about it.	It is very sad.  I have heard stories of people losing their family in different countries.
Only for funerals, unfortunately. Both my parents have since died. Unpleasant fact of life, I'm afraid.	I'm sorry to tell. I hope you were able to cope with your grief. I know I did. I hope you too.

Yes I was. I didn't come to the US until I was in my 30s. Didn't expect my Grandma to pass the minute I got here, but she was 96, so it shouldn't have been such a surprise!	It really isn, not. We had to get her to the church early and get her to the funeral.
She was as fit as a flea too. She tripped and broke her hip and got a bad infection in the hospital. That's what she died of!	emy grandparents helped me get to the US airport and to New York airport
I just bought an Xbox! I've never owned a gaming console before	That's awesome! What game are it?
I am! I bought Halo and am ready to ride.	that's cool, I bet you can play it on the go now!

My father passed away 2 years ago, but my mother lives in my neighborhood now. I'm so thankful she lives close by and still here with us. She's such a wonderful mother.	That must be tough.  I have a few family that live close by me and it's hard.  It seems like everyone has their own.

I'm sorry to hear that, I know it's so hard to lose a parent. I think we take them for granted when we are younger, but I am blessed she's still here.	that is such nice of you to think that. I know it's hard. I'm just trying to be there for her as much as possible. I'm not sure she knows I know, but I think she knows. I know how hard this life can be. I know how much I miss my mom.
I am as happy as a clam right now. My neighbors are away for the weekend!	I know how you feel. My neighbor's dog is getting a new dog walker!
The live upstairs and constantly thump around, screeching into their cellphones. And then there's the video games...	What video games do they have up there?

Oh I am, believe me I am. The world seems like a calm, serene place where everything is just right!	My friend from across the continent came over yesterday! I was so happy about it	That's so cool! Where did he or she come from and when was the visitation period?  Did you have any good time together?

We ended up hanging out and recording some audio. He is a voice actor	That's pretty rare! Did you guys hang out for a long time or just for an hour or so? What kind of things do you guys do in your free time?

I was out for a walk one night in a suburb of Boston when we heard the cries of a young animal. It was a baby kitten, with no collar, in a window well.	That must've been scary. Did you try to save it?
We actually did, and ended up adopting him. He was still so young he needed formula, but now he is thriving!	kes of doubt, i was scared!
I felt a need to help when the baby bird was by itself	I bet that felt very lonely.
I did not, I was little but I think I put it back into a tree	Oh wow that's really sad.  What happened to the baby bird?
Waiting to see if I would graduate was pretty unnerving	It's normal to have some anxiety about graduation, though.
Yep, had to take a class online over the summer but it worked out	oh thats so bad, how old are u?
I forgot my mother-in-law's birthday this year and can't look her in the eye!	I forgot a few times too.  What did you tell your mother in?

I just feel so embarrassed - she never forgets my birthday. And my husband was away and didn't remind me :(	Yeah, that's why you have to make it a habit to remind each of them every month or something.

You're right. She's a very forgiving person and I've never forgotten before. It's on St. Paddy's day for heavens sake - how could I forget???	I was the only one wearing pajamas at this party, not my greatest moment	That's okay, you did what everyone else did.  It is what you wear to the party that matters, not what you wore to the party.
I thought that it was a pajama party haha, never worn a dress before, maybe that's the secret	That is so cool. I wish you could go on more of these.
I had some trippy nightmares as a kid, now I don't really have dreams	I bet they were creepy. Do you remember what they said?
Yeah, it was like I was tied to a chair and a huge thing was staring at me, pretty weird	Oh, that's cool, I used to have nightmares about being chased by animals
I didn't realize that stealing was bad until I realized how it made me feel afterwards	That's terrible! How long were they stealing from?
No, I was scared to get charged, but I stopped after that	that's good to know that you know what's right and what's wrong with stealing
I was at a meditation retreat last year for 10 days and I can say that I experienced a better feeling there than I could ever remembe	Oh wow! What was the theme of your trip?

Yeah, thankfully there's an app for that - Headspace (no I am not sponsored)	That's really interesting. I think meditation is one thing you have to try out for yourself to believe it. It takes a lot of willpower to try to mediate.

I want to go see the Harry Potter land at Universal, the kids will love it.	I love the parky too!

Law School, I'm pretty sure I got in to my first choice, but you never know.	That's great news! I'm so happy for you!

Thank you, fingers are crossed.	I just ordered a new cookery book and am eagerly awaiting its arrival. I want to delve in and try lots of new recipes!	That sounds exciting!
